constraint.name: DWF_I_04 - Components must implements/uses accessible interfaces
constraint.message: The component {0} uses or implements the interface {1} defined in the {2} level
constraint.description: This rule checks that a component uses and implements only interface from valid architecture.

constraint.name: DWF_I_05 - No Equivalent Component Communication Links
constraint.message: {0}(Component) has {1} equivalent Communication Links (kind = {2}, protocol = {3}) targeting {4}(ExchangeItem)
constraint.description: This rule checks that the component cannot have the same kind of communication link targeting to the same exchange item with the same protocol.

constraint.name: DWF_I_06 - Interface location check
constraint.message: {0} (Interface Package) cannot be located under EPBS Architecture.
constraint.description: This rule checks that no Interface is located in EPBS.

constraint.name: DWF_I_07 - Interface location level
constraint.message: {0}({1}) uses or implements the interface {2} from {3} level.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a component uses/implements interfaces from the same level or from an upper level.

constraint.name: DWF_I_21 - Exchange Item Allocation Protocol consistency
constraint.message: Exchange Item Allocation {0} ({1}) should have ({2}) {3}.
constraint.description: This rule checks consistency between the allocated Exchange Item and Acquisition/Transmission protocols of Exchange Item Allocation

constraint.name: DWF_I_22 - Exchange Item Allocation Protocol used on Sequence Diagram consistency
constraint.message: Exchange Item Allocation {0} ({1}) should have ({2}) {3}, since it is referenced through {4} (Sequence Message) ({5}, {6} return message) in {7} (Scenario)
constraint.description: This rule checks consistency between the Acquisition/Transmission protocols of Exchange Item Allocation and its usage through Sequence Message

constraint.name: DWF_I_11 - ExchangeItemAllocation AllocatedItem Check
constraint.description: This rule checks that a ExchangeItemAllocation AllocatedItem value is not null.

constraint.name: DWF_I_12 - Exchange item allocation layer consistency
constraint.message: {0} (ExchangeItemAllocation) should not allocate {1} ({2}) of lower Architecture layer.
constraint.description:
This rule ensures that an ExchangeItemAllocation from given layer should not allocate element of lower Architecture layer.
Exmaple: If an ExchangeItemAllocation is on SystemArchitecture layer. It should not allocate any element from Logical or Physical Layer.

constraint.name: DWF_I_14 - Technical interface represent all communication links
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) does not represents all the communication links from {1} (Component) to {2} (Component). Exchange items {3} should be allocated to this interface.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an existing technical interface between two Components represent all the Communication Links with the same direction between those two components.

constraint.name: DWF_I_15 - Exchange Item Allocation For Technical Interface Has Communication Link
constraint.message: There is no corresponding communication link from component {0} to component {1} for the exchange item {2} that is allocated to interface {3}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that for each Exchange Item Allocation of a technical Interface, there is a Communication Link associated to it.

constraint.name: DWF_I_16 - Technical interfaces are not provided or required
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) can not be provided or required by components since it is a technical interface ({1}).
constraint.description: This rule checks that technical interfaces are not provided or required

constraint.name: DWF_I_17 - At most one technical interface between two components
constraint.message: Couple of components ({0}, {1}) has more than one technical interfaces ({2}).
constraint.description: This rule checks that there is at most one technical Interfaces by couple of component (direction is meaningful).

constraint.name: DWF_I_18 - Technical interfaces should not be used by more than one component
constraint.message: Technical interface {0} is used by more than one component ({1}).
constraint.description: This rule checks that a technical interfaces should not be used by more than one component.

constraint.name: DWF_I_19 - Technical interfaces should not be implemented by more than one component
constraint.message: Technical interface {0} is implemented by more than one component ({1}).
constraint.description: This rule checks that a technical interfaces should not be implemented by more than one component

constraint.name: DWF_I_20 - Interface does not contain similar Exchange Item Allocation
constraint.message: {0}(Interface) has {1} equivalent Exchange Item Allocation (protocols = {2}, {3}) targeting {4}(ExchangeItem)
constraint.description: This rule checks that an interface does not contain similar Exchange Item Allocation (that target the same Exchange Item and have same protocols).

constraint.name: DWF_DC_01 - Partitions cycles check
constraint.message: Part cycle: {0} {3} contains at a certain depth a part typed by {1} {4} and {1} {4} contains the part {2} {5} typed by {0} {3}.
constraint.description: This validation rule ensures that a partition of an element cannot have a partition typed by this element. Thus it avoids"partitions cycles".

constraint.name: DWF_DC_05 - Part type accessibility check
constraint.message: {0} (Part) is typed by inaccessible {1}.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a part is typed by an accessible Component.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_06 - Component Parts type level check
constraint.message: The Part {0} of {1} is typed by {2} which does not belong to the same level.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that each parts of a component have the same level (i.e context, logical, physical,...) that the component itself.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_33 - PhysicalPath allocated CE
constraint.description: This rule checks that a PhysicalPath should allocated component exchage between its path.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_30 - PhysicalPort on BehaviourPC
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a Physical Port is not contained in a Physical Component of nature BEHAVIOUR.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_07 - Part typed by an Abstract Type
constraint.message: {0} (Part) is typed by {1} which is abstract.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Part is typed by an abstract type.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_08 - Part typed
constraint.message: {0} (Part) does not have a type.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a part has always a type.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_09 - Component allocated functions types check
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Component allocates only leaf Functions of its own level.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_03 - Physical Path Involved Links check
constraint.message: {0} (PhysicalPath) {1}
constraint.description: This rule checks that a PhysicalPath is valid.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_24 - Physical Path involvement check involved element
constraint.message: ({0}) is not well formed. Involved element shall be set to {1}.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Physical Path Involvement only involves an Part, a Physical Link or a Physical Path.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_19 - Physical Link location check
constraint.message: The Physical Link "{0}" is not located in "{1}", the common ancestor between its source/target elements.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that Physical Link is located in the common ancestor between its source/target elements.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_36 - Component or Actor compositions checks
constraint.description: This rule checks Component or Actor composition following the rules below: 1. Component or Actor with the 'is Human' flag set on true cannot have sub Components, sub Actors, also no contained Parts or managing sub-packages. 2. An Operational Actor cannot be decomposed.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_37 - This rule checks that only one System Component is allowed at SystemAnalysis level
constraint.message: System cannot be decomposed.
constraint.description: This rule checks that only one System Component is allowed at SystemAnalysis level (cannot have parts inside a System nor component type)

constraint.name: DWF_DC_38 - This rule checks that only a Root Component exists at System/Logical/Physical level
constraint.description: This rule checks that only a Root Component exists at an Architectural level. Zero or more than one Root Components are not allowed.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_40 - This rule checks that an Operational Entity is not HUMAN
constraint.message: {0} cannot be HUMAN.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Operational Entity is not HUMAN.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_41 - This rule checks that an Operational Actor is HUMAN
constraint.message: {0} should be HUMAN.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Operational Actor is HUMAN.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_42 - Component with parts
constraint.message: {0} is not referenced by any Part.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a component is always referenced by at least one part.

constraint.name: DWF_DC_17 - Component self generalization not allowed
constraint.message: {0} generalizes itself.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that a Component cannot generalize itself.

constraint.name: I_05 - Component Realization consistency
constraint.message: Realization consistency error: {0}.
constraint.description: This rule ensures that Component Realization Realizations always have consistent Source and Target.

constraint.name: I_16 - Several Implementation/Use of the same interface by a component Check
constraint.message: {0} cannot {1} {2} (Interface) several times.
constraint.description: This rule allows to ensure that a component cannot implement the same interface several times or use the same interface several times.

constraint.name: I_17 - Contexts minimal content check
constraint.message: {0} ({1}) does not contain any root component part.
constraint.description: This rule checks that context packages contain at least one component (the root component) of the correct level.

constraint.name: I_29 - Physical path involvement check 1
constraint.message: {0} (Physical Path Involvement) has an empty next and/or previous involvement.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Physical Path Involvement has a valid next and/or previous involvement (not empty)

constraint.name: I_30 - Physical path involvement check 2
constraint.message: {0} (Physical Path Involvement) has an invalid next and/or previous involvement.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Physical Path Involvement has a valid next and/or previous involvement (contained by the same physical path)

constraint.name: I_41 - Component generalizes other Components with HUMAN different by its own
constraint.message: {0} is {1} but generalizes {2} Components.
constraint.description: This rule checks if a Component generalizes other Components with HUMAN different by its own.

constraint.name: I_42 - Component realizes other Components with HUMAN different by its own
constraint.message: {0} is {1} but realizes {2} Components.
constraint.description: Checks if a Component realizes other Components with HUMAN different by its own.

constraint.name: TJ_PA_11 - Interface realization check 2
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) is not realized by any Physical Interface.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Logical Interface is realized by at least one Physical Interface.

constraint.name: TJ_PA_09 - Physical Artifact Allocation
constraint.message: {0} {1} is not realized by any Configuration Item.
constraint.description: This rule checks that a Physical Artifact is realized by at least one Configuration Item.

constraint.name: DCOM_06 - Interface implementation 1
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) is not implemented by any Component or provided by any Component Port.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Interface is implemented by at least one Component.

constraint.name: DCOM_07 - Interface used by one sub logical componentat least
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) is not used by one of the sub Logical Component.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an interface is used by one of the sub Logical Component

constraint.name: DCOM_08 - Interface implemented by one logical component
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) is not implemented by one of the sub Logical Component.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Interface is implemented by one of the sub Logical Component.

constraint.name: DCOM_09 - Interface operations number check
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) doesn't contains any operation.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Interface contains at least one operation.

constraint.name: DCOV_01 - Interface used one component at least
constraint.message: {0} (Interface) is not used by any Component or required by any Component Port.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Interface is used by at least one Component.

constraint.name: DCOV_11 - Physical port Physical Link check
constraint.message: {0} (Physical Port) is not used by any Physical Link.
constraint.description: This rule generates a warning if there is no Physical Links using the target Physical Port.

constraint.name: TC_I_03 - Exchange item allocation check
constraint.message: The {1} (ExchangeItem) is defined into {2} level and realized into the {3} level. {0} Interface allocates {1} ExchangeItem instead of allocating realized ExchangeItem.
constraint.description: This rule checks that an Interface isn't linked to an ExchangeItem from a previous level whereas it is realized in the same level than the Interface. A warning can be raised if you have performed a transition of the Interface before performing a transition of the allocated ExchangeItem. You should perform another transition of the Interface from the lower level to use the realized ExchangeItem. Interface should be linked to the realized ExchangeItem.

constraint.name: DCOM_15 - Exchange item allocation consistency
constraint.description: This rule is applied to a Component 1) Checks that all Exchange Items allocated by its Interfaces are allocated to one of Function Ports of its allocated Functions. 2) Checks that all Exchange Items allocated by Function Ports of its allocated Functions are allocated to one of its Interfaces(used/implemented/provided/required).

constraint.name: DCOM_16 - Interface Exchange item allocation consistency
constraint.message: All exchange items allocated by {0} of {1} shall be allocated to one of functions ports of its allocated functions
constraint.description: This rule is applied to an Interface and checks that all Exchange Items allocated by an Interface of a Component are allocated to one of Function Ports of its allocated Functions.

constraint.name: DCOM_17 - Function Port Exchange item allocation consistency
constraint.message: All exchange items allocated by {0} shall be allocated to one of Interfaces of {1}
constraint.description: This rule is applied to a Function Port and checks that all Exchange Items allocated by a Function Port are allocated to one of Interfaces of its allocating Component

constraint.name: DWF_I_13 - Interface and Exchange item location check
constraint.message: The element {0} is linked through {3} [{2}] to {1} which is defined outside its namespace
constraint.description: This rule checks if a component is linked to interfaces and exchange items which are defined in a unavailable location (for instance a component should not be linked to an inner interface of another component)
